properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 11 at 3:46AM EST until January 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
The Flood Watch continues for

* A portion of central New York, including the following areas,
Northern Oneida and Southern Oneida.

* From this afternoon through Sunday evening

* A combination of 1 to 2 inches of rainfall and snow melt will
lead to significant runoff this afternoon into Sunday. The
runoff may result in minor flooding of some main stem rivers,
along with smaller rivers and streams. Poor drainage flooding is
also possible, especially in urban areas where snow or ice clog
storm drains. The highest rainfall totals will likely be in
northern Oneida County.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
